Collection of the most used markdown syntaxes

By Bui Quang Bao | March 20, 2021

Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor. Markdown is widely used in blogging, instant messaging, online forums, collaborative software, documentation pages, and readme files.

In this post, I will collect some of the most commonly-used markdown syntaxes.

# This is an <h1> tag
## This is an <h2> tag
### This is an <h3> tag
#### This is an <h4> tag
##### This is an <h5> tag
###### This is an <h6> tag

This is an <h1> tag

This is an <h2> tag

This is an <h3> tag

This is an <h4> tag

This is an <h5> tag
This is an <h6> tag


*Italic text*

Italic text


**Bold text**

Bold text


~~Strikethrough text~~

Strikethrough text


Combine: ***bold + italic*** or **bold + *italic* + ~~strikethrough~~**

Combine: bold + italic or bold + italic + strikethrough


* Item 1
* Item 2
  * Item 2a
  * Item 2b
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
    • Item 2a
    • Item 2b


1. Item 1
2. Item 2
   1. Item 3a
   2. Item 3b
  1. Item 1
  2. Item 2
    1. Item 3a
    2. Item 3b
